medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient developed vague diffuse abdominal pain primarily in the epigastrium 4 days prior to presentation. The pain worsened and localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) over the subsequent days. Severity ranged from mild to moderate with slight radiation to the right flank. Symptoms worsened with oral intake and movement, accompanied by anorexia and nausea. Developed constipation, which led to taking magnesium citrate the day prior to presentation, resulting in multiple loose watery bowel movements.
